channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Afghanistan: Girls excluded as Afghan secondary schools reopen
item.description: "Everything looks very dark," a schoolgirl tells the BBC as schools reopen for boys but not girls.

item.title: Aukus: France recalls envoys amid security pact row
item.description: The "exceptional decision" follows a pact between Australia, the US and UK, which scuppered a French deal.

item.title: Gabby Petito: Fiance Brian Laundrie goes missing too
item.description: Brian Laundrie, a person of interest in the disappearance of Gabby Petito, has gone missing.

item.title: Robert Durst convicted: US millionaire found guilty of first-degree murder
item.description: Durst was convicted of killing his best friend Susan Berman in 2000, and is likely to die in prison.

item.title: Abdelaziz Bouteflika: Former Algerian president dies aged 84
item.description: Bouteflika led Algeria for 20 years, but his bid for a fifth term led to huge protests in 2019.

item.title: Canada election: Why it takes 30 years to buy a house in Canada
item.description: Canada's skyrocketing housing costs have become a key election issue this year.

item.title: Migrants in Texas: US 'to fly thousands back to Haiti'
item.description: Thousands of migrants are camping under a Texas-Mexico border bridge, in squalid conditions.

item.title: Brazil legend Pele says he is 'recovering very well' after surgery
item.description: Brazil legend Pele says he is "recovering well" from a recent operation after briefly being readmitted to intensive care.

item.title: Police warn of threats ahead of right-wing rally at US Capitol
item.description: Fencing has been erected at the US Capitol to prevent chaos similar to the 6 January pro-Trump riot.

item.title: Afghanistan: US admits Kabul drone strike killed civilians
item.description: An inquiry finds the strike, days before the US pullout, killed 10 members of a family - not militants.

item.title: Chess icon sues Netflix for Queen's Gambit portrayal
item.description: Nona Gaprindashvili files a defamation lawsuit claiming she was incorrectly portrayed in the series.

item.title: Russian election: Opposition smart app removed as vote begins
item.description: The Smart Voting app promoted candidates most likely to defeat President Vladimir Putin's party.

item.title: The moment QAnon took the person I love most
item.description: People share with the BBC the moment they knew they had lost their loved one to QAnon.

item.title: Afghanistan: The escape of the whirling dancer
item.description: How the only female whirling dancer in Afghanistan made it out of Kabul.

item.title: Hyderabad rape suspect found dead: Is it murder or suicide?
item.description: Police say the 30-year-old man raped and killed a child in the city of Hyderabad last week.

item.title: German elections: How Angela Merkel changed her country
item.description: Young people have never known another leader, and many worry for the future as old certainties shift.

item.title: Bouteflika: Child prodigy to octogenarian leader
item.description: The former president, whose decades-long rule sparked massive protests, has died aged 84.

item.title: Mexico metro collapse: 'All I ever wanted was for my son to come home'
item.description: The mother of the youngest victim of Mexico's metro crash takes on some of the country's richest people.

item.title: 'Thereâ€™s security but no money': Afghans settle into life under Taliban rule
item.description: In Mazar-i-Sharif, former army pilots are flying Taliban around and families are selling possessions for food.

item.title: Kenya's CBC education reform: How scarecrows are terrifying parents
item.description: A new school curriculum means challenging tasks end up being performed by parents not their children.

item.title: Thousands of migrants gather at US-Mexico border crossing
item.description: At least 10,000 people are camped under the bridge at the US-Mexico border, in poor conditions.

item.title: Afghanistan: Kabul drone strike a terrible mistake, says US
item.description: Gen Frank McKenzie says the US "takes full responsibility" for the strike in which 10 Afghan civilians died.

item.title: Three Chinese astronauts return to Earth after 90 days in space
item.description: The three men make a safe return after 90 days in space - China's longest ever crewed mission.

item.title: How TikTokers took down a Texas anti-abortion site
item.description: A draconian abortion ban in Texas has Gen Z fighting its enforcement through hacktivism

item.title: North Korea reveals train-launched missile system
item.description: North Korean state media has unveiled what appears to be a new rail-based ballistic missile system.
